intro: Calonyction muticum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower heads surrounded by spiny, leaf-like bracts. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to salty, windy environments. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calonyction muticum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
